bcl:subsection.bcl:text: There is to be a ministry of the public service of British Columbia called the Ministry of Intergovernmental Relations.
The minister is to preside over the ministry and be responsible to the Lieutenant Governor in Council for the direction of the ministry.

bcl:section.bcl:text: One or more deputy ministers of the ministry may be appointed under the Public Service Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Purposes and functions of the ministry
bcl:section.bcl:text: The purposes and functions of the ministry include the duty

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: to coordinate the activities of, to make recommendations to, and to develop programs and policies for the Executive Council in relation to federal-provincial, interprovincial and extraprovincial affairs, and
to act as secretariat to the Executive Council and its committees and to coordinate policy development among the ministries.

bcl:section.bcl:text: With the approval of the Lieutenant Governor in Council, the minister on behalf of the government may enter into agreements with the government of Canada, the government of a province or an agent of the government of Canada or a province.
